info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 10:53AM EDT until July 14 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Monongalia County in northern West Virginia... Eastern Wetzel County in northern West Virginia... Central Marion County in northern West Virginia... * Until 1130 AM EDT. * At 1052 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fairview, or near Mannington, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Fairmont, Mannington, Pleasant Valley, Winfield, Barrackville, Fairview, Cassville, Rivesville, Grant Town, Farmington, Everettville, Baxter, Rachel, McCurdyville, Crown, Wana, Metz, Wadestown, Colfax, and Daybrook. This includes Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 134 and 140, and between mile markers 156 and 158. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
